sub_title: sociologist, social worker, senior lecturer, international project developer, author, film maker
summary: In 1967 I began my career as a voluntary community worker in a huge neighborhood in decline in The Hague, the Netherlands. In 1978 I moved to the southern region of Zeeuwsch-Vlaanderen and continued my social engagement by organizing care users and implementing action- and system research to improve the modestly equipped regional health care services. I combined these activities with my studies: social work, sociology, and management of non profit organizations. In 1983 I started my professional career as a part-time researcher at the Catholic (now Radbout) University in Nijmegen. I continued my career as a full-time executive with educational and developmental tasks, later director, of a regional community development institute (WONN) in Drachten. From 1992 untill 2016 I was senior lecturer at Social Work studies of NHLStenden University of Applied Sciences in Leeuwarden. In addition to that I hold a parttime position as a senior lecturer at Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznan, Poland, from 2002-2005. Today I am still active on a personal base in The Netherlands and abroad with education, research & development, publishing books & articles (see further) and making films (see 'Blok Social Video Works' on YouTube).

company.name: NHL Stenden University of Applied Sciences in Leeuwarden

profile_positions.company: NHL Stenden University of Applied Sciences in Leeuwarden
profile_positions.description: Lecturing and developing courses in theory, methods, organization, development and internationalization of Social Work, as well as in social history, organization- and policy theory, and marketing at NHL University (now NHLStenden University), at schools and universities abroad (in Poland, Lithuania, Germany, Belgium, Ireland, and Canada) and at conferences. I developed and managed the Minor International Social Work at NHL University (from 2011), including the international Joint E-Project for social work students with Canada (pilot in 2010), and after 2011 with Ireland and Switzerland. I was actively involved in modernization of Social Work & Local Social Policy in Poland from 1992-2008. First as coordinating lecturer in the Tempus Poznan Project (1992-1995), after that as initiator, developer & manager of the Matra COP Project (1998-2001) and the Matra SIC! Project (2003-2007) (see the project section), and as senior lecturer at Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznan (2003-2005). From 2010-2016 I initiated and organized the 'Annual International Conferences on Social Work and Social Work Education' in Leeuwarden (The Netherlands). In 2016 I was one of the initiators /establishers of the Dutch-Flemish Network of the Capability Approach in the Social Domain (CA-SD) (see the"Projects" section).  Since 1968 I write books, articles, reports etc. in Dutch and English language (see the list of my publications). I also make social documentaries, travel films, and video clips of musicians (see Blok Social Video Works on YouTube).
